Interface UsersApiBase

All Known Subinterfaces:
UsersApi, UsersApiAuth
public interface UsersApiBase
Access registered users on Lichess.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Many<Activity>
    activityById(String userId)
    Read data to generate the activity feed of a user.
    Many<String>
    autocompleteNames(String term)
    Autocomplete names given the starting 3 or more characters of a username
    Many<UserStatus>
    autocompleteUsers(String term)
    Autocomplete names given the starting 3 or more characters of a username
    One<Crosstable>
    crosstable(String userId1, String userId2)
     
    One<Crosstable>
    crosstable(String userId1, String userId2, boolean matchup)
     
    One<Crosstable>
    crosstable(String userId1, String userId2, Consumer<UsersApi.CrosstableParams> consumer)
    Get total number of games, and current score, of any two users.
    If the `matchup` flag is provided, and the users are currently playing, also gets the current match game number and scores.
    One<Leaderboard>
    leaderboard(int nb, Enums.PerfTypeNoCorr perfType)
    Get the leaderboard for a single speed or variant (a.k.a.
    Many<LiveStreamer>
    liveStreamers()
    Read the status of current live streamers
    This API is very fast and cheap on lichess side.
    So you can call it quite often (like once every 5 seconds).
    One<PerformanceStatistics>
    performanceStatisticsByIdAndType(String userId, Enums.PerfType type)
    Read performance statistics of a user, for a single performance.
    Many<RatingHistory>
    ratingHistoryById(String userId)
    Read rating history of a user, for all performance types.
    default One<UserStatus>
    statusById(String userId, Consumer<UsersApi.UserStatusParams> consumer)
    Read the `online` and `playing` flag of a user.
    default Many<UserStatus>
    statusByIds(boolean withGameIds, String... userIds)
    Deprecated.
    use statusByIds(Collection, Consumer)
    default Many<UserStatus>
    statusByIds(String... userIds)
    statusByIds(Collection)
    default Many<UserStatus>
    statusByIds(Collection<String> userIds)
     
    default Many<UserStatus>
    statusByIds(Collection<String> userIds, boolean withGameIds)
    Deprecated.
    use statusByIds(Collection, Consumer)
    Many<UserStatus>
    statusByIds(Collection<String> userIds, Consumer<UsersApi.UserStatusParams> consumer)
    Read the `online` and `playing` flags of several users.
    This API is very fast and cheap on lichess side, so you can call it quite often (like once every 5 seconds).
    Use it to track players and know when they're connected on lichess and playing games.
    Implementation Note, if the set of user ids is larger than 100 user ids,
    the user ids will be split into groups of 100s and separate requests will be made for each group.
    One<UserTopAll>
    top10()
    Get the top 10 players for each speed and variant.

      default Many<UserStatus> statusByIds(Collection<String> userIds)

    • statusByIds

      @Deprecated default Many<UserStatus> statusByIds(Collection<String> userIds, boolean withGameIds)
      Deprecated.
      use statusByIds(Collection, Consumer)
      statusByIds(Collection)
      Parameters:
      withGameIds - If set to true, the id of the game the users are playing, if any, will be included. Default: false

    • statusByIds

      @Deprecated default Many<UserStatus> statusByIds(boolean withGameIds, String... userIds)
      Deprecated.
      use statusByIds(Collection, Consumer)
      statusByIds(Collection)

      default Many<UserStatus> statusByIds(String... userIds)
      statusByIds(Collection)

    • crosstable

      One<Crosstable> crosstable(String userId1, String userId2, Consumer<UsersApi.CrosstableParams> consumer)
      Get total number of games, and current score, of any two users.
      If the `matchup` flag is provided, and the users are currently playing, also gets the current match game number and scores.

    • crosstable

      One<Crosstable> crosstable(String userId1, String userId2)

    • activityById

      Many<Activity> activityById(String userId)
      Read data to generate the activity feed of a user.
      Parameters:
      userId -

    • top10

      One<UserTopAll> top10()
      Get the top 10 players for each speed and variant.

    • statusByIds

      Many<UserStatus> statusByIds(Collection<String> userIds, Consumer<UsersApi.UserStatusParams> consumer)
      Read the `online` and `playing` flags of several users.
      This API is very fast and cheap on lichess side, so you can call it quite often (like once every 5 seconds).
      Use it to track players and know when they're connected on lichess and playing games.
      Implementation Note, if the set of user ids is larger than 100 user ids,
      the user ids will be split into groups of 100s and separate requests will be made for each group.
      Parameters:
      userIds -

    • statusById

      default One<UserStatus> statusById(String userId, Consumer<UsersApi.UserStatusParams> consumer)
      Read the `online` and `playing` flag of a user.

    • liveStreamers

      Many<LiveStreamer> liveStreamers()
      Read the status of current live streamers
      This API is very fast and cheap on lichess side.
      So you can call it quite often (like once every 5 seconds).

    • leaderboard

      One<Leaderboard> leaderboard(int nb, Enums.PerfTypeNoCorr perfType)
      Get the leaderboard for a single speed or variant (a.k.a. `perfType`).
      There is no leaderboard for correspondence or puzzles.
      Parameters:
      nb - How many users to fetch. Min 1, Max 100.
      perfType - Which speed or variant leaderboard.

    • ratingHistoryById

      Many<RatingHistory> ratingHistoryById(String userId)
      Read rating history of a user, for all performance types. There is at most one entry per day.
      Parameters:
      userId -

    • performanceStatisticsByIdAndType

      One<PerformanceStatistics> performanceStatisticsByIdAndType(String userId, Enums.PerfType type)
      Read performance statistics of a user, for a single performance.
      Parameters:
      userId -
      type -

    • autocompleteNames

      Many<String> autocompleteNames(String term)
      Autocomplete names given the starting 3 or more characters of a username
      Parameters:
      term - The beginning of a username >= 3 characters

    • autocompleteUsers

      Many<UserStatus> autocompleteUsers(String term)
      Autocomplete names given the starting 3 or more characters of a username
      Parameters:
      term - The beginning of a username >= 3 characters
